column8: Answer3 Text
Bicycles have the right-of-way
regulation signs (regulatory signs)
Buggy warning

column2: 4. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column4: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.
column8: speed up to beat the train.
column10: yield to all trains at the crossing.

column8: Low ground clearance railroad crossing
no sharp turn

column2: 7. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column8: vehicles from both directions.

column4: the lane to the right may pass.
column6: passing is not permitted in either direction.
column8: passing is permitted in either direction.
column10: the lane to the left may pass.

column2: 9. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column6: As close as possible to the center line.
column8: As far to the right as possible.
the road may be slippery when wet.
column10: no turns are allowed on this road.

column2: 11. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column6: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column8: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column10: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.

column4: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column6: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.

column2: 13. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column6: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column8: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column10: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.

column2: 14. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.
column6: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.
column8: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
column10: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.

column2: 15. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column6: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column8: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
narrow bridge ahead.

column2: 17. A fully loaded tractor-trailer traveling 55 MPH could take up to ______ to come to a complete stop.
column8: 400 feet
Keep to the side indicated by the arrow

column2: 19. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column8: stay in the center of your lane
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column8: No right turn

column2: 21. This sign is used to warn drivers about:
column8: curves ahead.

column2: 22. When driving on slippery roads, drivers should:
column8: increase their following distance.

column2: 23. You should increase your following distance when:
column6: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.
column8: exiting a freeway.

column2: 24. To take the Missouri driver examination tests, you should go to:
column4: the nearest high school driver education class.
column8: any Missouri State Highway Patrol examination station.
how much time passes between drinks.
